titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale Summer Cabaret Scripts and Ephemera Collection
Yale Summer Cabaret Scripts and Ephemera Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Monica Achen

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday December 7, 2018 at 00:06

did.unittitle: Yale Summer Cabaret Scripts and Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains scripts and ephemera from the Yale Summer Cabaret (formerly known as the Ensemble Company for the Performing Arts).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Summer Cabaret Scripts and Ephemera Collection was housed in the former Drama Library until its transfer to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library in 2008. The 2014 addition, which included materials for the period 1974 through 2014, was a gift of Don Lowy on behalf of the Yale Summer Cabaret Advisory Board. The 2015 addition was also delivered by Don Lowy on behalf of the Yale Summer Cabaret Advisory Board.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale Summer Cabaret Scripts and Ephemera Collection, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains scripts and ephemera, such as programs, flyers, and posters, as well as photographs from the Yale Summer Cabaret.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale Summer Cabaret is a wholly separate organization from the Yale Cabaret. It has been in operation since 1974. From 1974 until 2008, it was known as the Ensemble Company for the Performing Arts or ECPA (also referred to as the Ensemble Company for the Creative Arts). ECPA was dissolved on May 16, 2008, and absorbed by the Yale School of Drama. Yale Summer Cabaret has, since its inception, been managed by Yale School of Drama students. It stages three to four productions per summer in a venue with under 100 reconfigurable seats. Food and drink are served before each performance. Yale Summer Cabaret produces adaptations of published plays, student-written plays, and collaboratively devised pieces.

A detailed history of Yale Summer Cabaret productions is available in the repository. This documentation has been compiled and provided by Don Lowy on behalf of the YSC Executive Board (last updated September 22, 2014).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series and one addition: I. Scripts. II. Ephemera. 2014 Addition.

controlaccess.corpname: Ensemble Company for the Performing Arts
Ensemble Company for the Creative Arts

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by season, then alphabetically by the playwright's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes ephemera such as posters, programs, photographs, clippings, advertisements, press releases, and newsletters pertaining to ECPA and Yale Summer Cabaret.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by year and then by month and day of performance.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: There was no Summer Cabaret in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This year marks the end of the ECPA. It was dissolved on May 16, 2008, and was absorbed by the Yale School of Drama.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 2014 addition includes programs and flyers, photographs, original scripts, and posters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Each grouping of materials is arranged chronologically by season.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains season flyers and posters as well as programs and posters for individual shows. It also includes some reproductions of these materials (as noted).
